intro: Ceropegia ariyittaparensis, commonly known as the Sri Lankan milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with a distinctive hooded structure. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
